titleInfo.title: Letter No 6 of 1822 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The outermost edge of the folio has suffered damage and some of the ink has faded. As a result, some of the text in this item is difficult to read.

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that the Resident has found the Residency house to be 'scarcely habitable', and has therefore ordered a basic level of repairs to be undertaken to prevent the building falling into complete ruin; further work will be needed to make it fit for purpose.
